```py
>>> from scipy.sparse import csr_array, tril
>>> A = csr_array([[1, 2, 0, 0, 3], [4, 5, 0, 6, 7], [0, 0, 8, 9, 0]],
...               dtype='int32')
>>> A.toarray()
array([[1, 2, 0, 0, 3],
 [4, 5, 0, 6, 7],
 [0, 0, 8, 9, 0]])
>>> tril(A).toarray()
array([[1, 0, 0, 0, 0],
 [4, 5, 0, 0, 0],
 [0, 0, 8, 0, 0]])
>>> tril(A).nnz
4
>>> tril(A, k=1).toarray()
array([[1, 2, 0, 0, 0],
 [4, 5, 0, 0, 0],
 [0, 0, 8, 9, 0]])
>>> tril(A, k=-1).toarray()
array([[0, 0, 0, 0, 0],
 [4, 0, 0, 0, 0],
 [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]])
>>> tril(A, format='csc')
<3x5 sparse array of type '<class 'numpy.int32'>'
 with 4 stored elements in Compressed Sparse Column format> 
```
